original_content:
message_id: 1758618cedf98ef1
subject   : Subject: OUR HOPE--(11-2-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 1 Nov 2020 17:16:14 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*For a child is born to us, a son is given to us. And the*

*government will rest on His shoulders. These will be *

*His royal titles: Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God,*

*Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace. *(Isa. 9:6)



*Today's Reflection:*

Back in a time of darkness, God promised to send a

light who would shine on everyone living in the

shadow of death. Isaiah describes Him as both

“Wonderful Counselor” and “Mighty God.” This

message of hope was fulfilled in the birth of Christ

and the establishment of His eternal Kingdom. *He *

*came to deliver all people* *from their slavery to sin.*



*You may think I have lost it. This message is some-*

*thing we expect to hear during December, and*

*your right**! BUT let us pray that whatever kind of*

* government we will experience in the next four*

*years will depend on our Great Counselor. I hope *

*you agree with me that this will depend upon*

*every Christian praying that or governmental*

* leaders will look to the Great Counselor to guide*

*them. Let us also pray that we TOO will look for*

* His guidance.*

* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text:
Back in a time of darkness, God promised to send a
light who would shine on everyone living in the
shadow of death. Isaiah describes Him as both
“Wonderful Counselor” and “Mighty God.” This
message of hope was fulfilled in the birth of Christ
and the establishment of His eternal Kingdom. He came to deliver all people from their slavery to sin. You may think I have lost it. This message is some thing we expect to hear during December, and your right!
BUT let us pray that whatever kind of government we will experience in the next four years will depend on our Great Counselor. I hope you agree with me that this will depend upon every Christian praying that or governmental leaders will look to the Great Counselor to guide them.
Let us also pray that we TOO will look for His guidance.
original_verse_text: For a child is born to us, a son is given to us. And the government will rest on His shoulders. These will be  His royal titles: Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the promise of the Wonderful Counselor and Mighty God, fulfilled in the birth of Your Son, Jesus Christ. We pray that our governmental leaders would seek Your wisdom and guidance, that they may lead with justice and righteousness. May we also look to You, the Great Counselor, to direct our steps and establish Your eternal Kingdom. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Back in a time of darkness, God promised to send a light who would shine on everyone living in the shadow of death. Isaiah describes Him as both “Wonderful Counselor” and “Mighty God.” This message of hope was fulfilled in the birth of Christ and the establishment of His eternal Kingdom. He came to deliver all people from their slavery to sin. You may think I have lost it. This message is some thing we expect to hear during December, and your right! BUT let us pray that whatever kind of government we will experience in the next four years will depend on our Great Counselor. I hope you agree with me that this will depend upon every Christian praying that or governmental leaders will look to the Great Counselor to guide them. Let us also pray that we TOO will look for His guidance.
subject: Our Hope
verse_text: For a child is born to us, a son is given to us. And the government will rest on His shoulders. These will be  His royal titles: Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.

original_content:
message_id: 17589ef0e978fb55
subject   : Subject: FITTING FOR (11-3-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 2 Nov 2020 11:09:07 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Verse for Today:*
*Appoint judges and officials* for each of your tribes in all
the towns the Lord your God is giving you. They will judge
the people fairly throughout the land. (Deut. 16:18)

*Personal Reflection:*
It is a serious responsibility to appoint *or* elect wise and just
officials. In your sphere of influence--home, school, church,
job--are you ensuring that justice and godliness prevail?
*Failing **to choose leaders who uphold justice can lead*
*too serious problems--(Like Israel discovered). *
* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: It is a serious responsibility to appoint or elect wise and just officials. In your sphere of influence--home, school, church, job--are you ensuring that justice and godliness prevail? Failing to choose leaders who uphold justice can lead too serious problems--(Like Israel discovered).
original_verse_text: for Today: Appoint judges and officials for each of your tribes in all the towns the Lord your God is giving you. They will judge the people fairly throughout the land.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we acknowledge the gravity of choosing wise and righteous leaders, as Your Word instructs. Grant us discernment to select officials who will govern with justice and integrity, that Your name may be honored and Your people may flourish. May we be faithful stewards of the authority You have entrusted to us, that our communities may reflect Your heart for righteousness. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: It is a serious responsibility to appoint or elect wise and just officials. In your sphere of influence—home, school, church, job—are you ensuring that justice and godliness prevail? Failing to choose leaders who uphold justice can lead to serious problems (like Israel discovered).
subject: Fitting For
verse_text: for Today: Appoint judges and officials for each of your tribes in all the towns the Lord your God is giving you. They will judge the people fairly throughout the land.

original_content:
message_id: 175955dfdaa3aef7
subject   : Subject: IS CONTAGIOUS (11-5-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 4 Nov 2020 16:26:06 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*All the while praising God and enjoying the good will*

*of all the people. And each day the Lord added to*

*their group those who were being saved. *(Acts 2:47)



*My Reflection:*

A healthy Christian community attracts people to

Christ. A healthy, loving church will grow in

numbers. *What are you doing to make your *

*church the kind of place that attracts others *

*to Christ?*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
A healthy Christian community attracts people to
Christ. A healthy, loving church will grow in
numbers. What are you doing to make your church the kind of place that attracts others to Christ?
original_verse_text: All the while praising God and enjoying the good will of all the people. And each day the Lord added to their group those who were being saved.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the example of the early church, where the believers were united in heart and mind, and Your power was evident through their witness. Lord, grant us the same spirit of unity and devotion, that our church may be a beacon of Your love and grace, drawing others to know the salvation found in Jesus Christ. May our lives and our community reflect the transformative work of Your Spirit, that many may come to know You. Amen.
reflection: A healthy Christian community attracts people to Christ. A healthy, loving church will grow in numbers. What are you doing to make your church the kind of place that attracts others to Christ?
subject: Is Contagious
verse_text: All the while praising God and enjoying the good will of all the people. And each day the Lord added to their group those who were being saved.

original_content:
message_id: 1759a87f51e49c6e
subject   : Subject: REAL LOVE TAKES EFFORT (11-6-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 5 Nov 2020 16:30:03 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Don’t just pretend you love others. **Really love them!*

*Hate what is wrong. Stand on the side of good. *(Ro. 12:9)



*My thoughts Today:*

Most of us have learned to be courteous to others—

how to speak kindly. Avoid hurting their feelings,

and appear to take interest in them. We may even

be skilled in pretending to show compassion when

we hear of others’ needs, or to become indignant

when we learn of injustice. BUT God calls us to

real and sincere love that goes beyond being hypo-

critical and polite. Sincere love requires concentra-

tion and effort. It means helping others become

better people. It demands our time, money, and

personal involvement. No individual has the cap,

acity to express love to a whole community, but

the body of Christ in your town does. *Look for*

*people who need your love, and look for ways*

*you and your fellow believers can love your*

*community for Christ.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Most of us have learned to be courteous to others - how to
speak kindly. Avoid hurting their feelings, and appear to
take interest in them. We may even be skilled in pretending
to show compassion when we hear of others’ needs, or to
become indignant when we learn of injustice. BUT God calls
us to real and sincere love that goes beyond being
hypocritical and polite. Sincere love requires concentration
and effort. It means helping others become better people. It
demands our time, money, and personal involvement. No
individual has the cap, acity to express love to a whole
community, but the body of Christ in your town does. Look
for people who need your love, and look for ways you and
your fellow believers can love your community for Christ.
original_verse_text:
Don’t just pretend you love others. Really love them! Hate
what is wrong. Stand on the side of good.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to grow in sincere love that goes beyond mere words. Help us to move beyond superficial politeness and truly care for one another, as Your Word instructs in Romans 12:9 and 1 John 3:18. May our love be genuine, expressed through our actions and personal involvement in the lives of those around us. Guide us, Lord, to see the needs in our community and to respond with the compassion and time that You have shown to us. We desire to be Your hands and feet, loving others for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: Most of us have learned to be courteous to others - how to speak kindly. Avoid hurting their feelings, and appear to take interest in them. We may even be skilled in pretending to show compassion when we hear of others’ needs, or to become indignant when we learn of injustice. BUT God calls us to real and sincere love that goes beyond being hypocritical and polite. Sincere love requires concentration and effort. It means helping others become better people. It demands our time, money, and personal involvement. No individual has the cap, acity to express love to a whole community, but the body of Christ in your town does. Look for people who need your love, and look for ways you and your fellow believers can love your community for Christ.
subject: Real Love Takes Effort
verse_text:
Don’t just pretend you love others. Really love them! Hate
what is wrong. Stand on the side of good.

original_content:
message_id: 1759f8856a2f056d
subject   : Subject: DEMONSTRATED WHEN WE FORGIVE OUR ENEMIES (11-7-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 6 Nov 2020 15:48:34 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s verses:*

*Dear friends, never avenge yourselves. Leave that to God. For it is
written, “I will take vengeance; I will repay those who deserve it,” says
the Lord. Instead, do what the Scriptures say .If your enemies are hungry,
feed them. If they are thirsty give them a drink, and they will feel
ashamed of what they have done to you. Don’t let evil get the bet of you.,
conquer evil by doing good. **(*Ro. 12:19-21)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Forgiveness involves both attitudes and actions. If you find it difficult
to feel forgiving toward someone who

has hurt you, try praying for them, and your attitude

every day. Then try responding with kind actions. If appropriate tell this
person that you would like to heal your relationship. Lend a helping hand.
Send him or her

a gift. Smile at him or her. *Many times you will discover right actions
lead to right feelings.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Forgiveness involves both attitudes and actions. If you find it difficult to feel forgiving toward someone who has hurt you, try praying for them, and your attitude every day. Then try responding with kind actions.
If appropriate tell this person that you would like to heal your relationship.
Lend a helping hand. Send him or her a gift. Smile at him or her. Many times you will discover right actions lead to right feelings.
original_subject: DEMONSTRATED WHEN WE FORGIVE OUR ENEMIES
original_verse_text: Dear friends, never avenge yourselves. Leave that to God. For it is written, “I will take vengeance; I will repay those who deserve it,” says the Lord. Instead, do what the Scriptures say .If your enemies are hungry, feed them. If they are thirsty give them a drink, and they will feel ashamed of what they have done to you. Don’t let evil get the bet of you., conquer evil by doing good.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your guidance and wisdom. Help us to follow the example of Your Son, who loved and prayed for His enemies. Grant us the strength to forgive those who have wronged us, and the courage to respond with kindness and compassion. May our actions lead to reconciliation and the restoration of broken relationships. Lord, transform our hearts, that we may reflect Your love and grace. Amen.
reflection: Forgiveness involves both attitudes and actions. If you find it difficult to feel forgiving toward someone who has hurt you, try praying for them and your attitude every day. Then try responding with kind actions. If appropriate, tell this person that you would like to heal your relationship. Lend a helping hand. Send him or her a gift. Smile at him or her. Many times you will discover right actions lead to right feelings.
subject: Demonstrated When We Forgive Our Enemies
verse_text: Dear friends, never avenge yourselves. Leave that to God. For it is written, “I will take vengeance; I will repay those who deserve it,” says the Lord. Instead, do what the Scriptures say .If your enemies are hungry, feed them. If they are thirsty give them a drink, and they will feel ashamed of what they have done to you. Don’t let evil get the bet of you., conquer evil by doing good.

original_content:
message_id: 175a4e0f755bdbab
subject   : Subject: WHY IS LOVE FOR OTHERS CALLED A DEBT (11-8-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 7 Nov 2020 16:43:28 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Pay all your debts, except the debt of love for others. *

*You can **never finish paying that debt. *(Ro. 13:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Why is love for others called a debt? We are permanently in debt to
Christ, for the lavished love He has poured out on us.The only way we can
even began to repay this debt is by loving others in return. Because
Christ’s love will always be infinitely greater than ours. *We will always
have the **obligation to love our neighbor.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Why is love for others called a debt? We are permanently in debt to Christ, for the lavished love He has poured out on us.The only way we can even began to repay this debt is by loving others in return. Because Christ’s love will always be infinitely greater than ours. We will always have the obligation to love our neighbor.
original_subject: WHY IS LOVE FOR OTHERS CALLED A DEBT
original_verse_text: Pay all your debts, except the debt of love for others.  You can never finish paying that debt.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the boundless love You have shown us through Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to live out this debt of love, not as a burden, but as a joyful response to the grace we have received. May our love for one another reflect the selfless, sacrificial love of Christ, that the world may see Your goodness and be drawn to You. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Why is love for others called a debt? We are permanently in debt to Christ, for the lavished love He has poured out on us. The only way we can even begin to repay this debt is by loving others in return. Because Christ's love will always be infinitely greater than ours. We will always have the obligation to love our neighbor.
subject: Why is Love for Others Called a Debt
verse_text: Pay all your debts, except the debt of love for others.  You can never finish paying that debt.

original_content:
message_id: 175aa18d756f52eb
subject   : Subject: THE LAW OF LOVE (10-9-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 8 Nov 2020 17:02:36 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*



*Love—does no wrong to anyone, so love satisfied all *

*of God’s require**ements. **(Ro 13;10)*



*Today’s Reflection:*

Christians must obey the law of love, which supersedes both religious and
civil laws. How easy it is to excuse

our indifference to others merely because we have no

legal obligation to help them and even to justify harm-

ing them if our actions are technically legal. *But* Jesus does not leave
loopholes in the law of love. Whenever love demands it, we are to go beyond
human legal requirements and imitate the God of love. *Jm. 2:8-9,*

*4;11, and I Pet. 2:16-17 say more about this law* *of *

*love. *

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Christians must obey the law of love, which supersedes both religious and civil laws. How easy it is to excuse our indifference to others merely because we have no legal obligation to help them and even to justify harm ing them if our actions are technically legal. But Jesus does not leave loopholes in the law of love. Whenever love demands it, we are to go beyond human legal requirements and imitate the God of love. James 2:8-9, 4;11, and I Peter 2:16-17 say more about this law of love.
original_verse_text: Love-does no wrong to anyone, so love satisfied all  of God’s requirements.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that Your law of love supersedes all others. Help us to see beyond the technicalities of human laws and instead be guided by the selfless love that You have shown us. May we never use legality as an excuse to neglect or harm others, but may we instead strive to imitate Your compassion and care for all people. Grant us the wisdom and courage to live out the Great Commandment, loving You with all our heart, soul, and mind, and loving our neighbors as ourselves. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Christians must obey the law of love, which supersedes both religious and civil laws. How easy it is to excuse our indifference to others merely because we have no legal obligation to help them and even to justify harming them if our actions are technically legal. But Jesus does not leave loopholes in the law of love. Whenever love demands it, we are to go beyond human legal requirements and imitate the God of love. James 2:8-9, 4:11, and 1 Peter 2:16-17 say more about this law of love.
subject: The Law of Love
verse_text: Love-does no wrong to anyone, so love satisfied all  of God’s requirements.

original_content:
message_id: 175befb70f35a066
subject   : Subject: WHY CHRISTIANS HAVE NO EXCUSE FOR NOT LOVING OTHERS
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 12 Nov 2020 18:22:31 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
(11-13-20)

*Today’s Verse:*

*He is the one who has told us about the great love for others **that the
Holy Spirit has given you *(Col. 1:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Because of our love for one another, Christians can have

an impact that goes far beyond our neighborhoods and communities.
Christian love
comes from the Holy Spirit (Ga. 5:22). The Bible speaks of it as an action
and attitude, not just an emotion. Love is a by-product of our new life in
Christ (Ro. 5:5; I Cor. 13). *Christians have no ex**cuse *

*for not loving, because Christian* *love is a decision to act in **the
best interest of others.*

*Pastor Sather*



Sorry if you have missed the morning devo’s but I have been

having computer problems.
original_reflection_text:
Because of our love for one another, Christians can have an impact that goes far beyond our neighborhoods and communities.
Christian love comes from the Holy Spirit (Ga. 5:22). The Bible speaks of it as an action and attitude, not just an emotion. Love is a byproduct of our new life in Christ (Romans 5:5; I Corinthians 13). Christians have no excuse for not loving, because Christian love is a decision to act in the best interest of others.
original_subject: WHY CHRISTIANS HAVE NO EXCUSE FOR NOT LOVING OTHERS
original_verse_text: He is the one who has told us about the great love for others that the Holy Spirit has given you.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of love that You have poured out in our hearts through the power of the Holy Spirit. Help us to love one another with the same sacrificial love that You have shown us in Christ. May our love for one another be a testimony to the world of Your transforming power, and may it draw others to the saving knowledge of Your Son. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Because of our love for one another, Christians can have an impact that goes far beyond our neighborhoods and communities. Christian love comes from the Holy Spirit (Gal. 5:22). The Bible speaks of it as an action and attitude, not just an emotion. Love is a byproduct of our new life in Christ (Romans 5:5; 1 Corinthians 13). Christians have no excuse for not loving, because Christian love is a decision to act in the best interest of others.
subject: Why Christians Have No Excuse for Not Loving Others
verse_text: He is the one who has told us about the great love for others that the Holy Spirit has given you.

original_content:
message_id: 175c9023a56a6daf
subject   : Subject: CAN YOU LOVE SOMEONE BUT STILL DISLIKE THEM? (11-15-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 14 Nov 2020 17:06:08 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*If anyone says, “I am living in the light,” but hates a *

*Christian brother or sister, that person is still living in *

*darkness. Anyone who loves other Christians is living *

*in the light and does not cause anyone to stumble. *

*Anyone who hates a Christian brother **or sister is walk-*

*ing in darkness. Such a person is lost, having been blinded *

*by the darkness.* (I Jn. 2:9-11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Does this mean that if we dislike some-one we are not a Christian? These
verses are not talking about disliking a disagreeable Christian brother or
sister. There will always

be people we will not like as well as others. John’s words

focus on the attitude that causes us to ignore or despise

others, to treat them as irritants, competitors, or enemies.

Christian love is not a feeling but a choice. We can choose

to be concerned with people’s well-being and treat them

with respect, whether or not we feel affection toward them.

*If we choose to love* *others, God **will help us express our love.*

*Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Does this mean that if we dislike someone we are not a Christian? These verses are not talking about disliking a disagreeable Christian brother or sister. There will always be people we will not like as well as others. John’s words focus on the attitude that causes us to ignore or despise others, to treat them as irritants, competitors, or enemies. Christian love is not a feeling but a choice. We can choose
to be concerned with people’s well-being and treat them with respect, whether or not we feel affection toward them. If we choose to love others, God will help us express our love.
original_subject: CAN YOU LOVE SOMEONE BUT STILL DISLIKE THEM?
original_verse_text: If anyone says, “I am living in the light,” but hates a  Christian brother or sister, that person is still living in  darkness. Anyone who loves other Christians is living  in the light and does not cause anyone to stumble.  Anyone who hates a Christian brother or sister is walk- ing in darkness. Such a person is lost, having been blinded  by the darkness.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that true love is not a mere feeling, but a choice to care for and respect others, even those we may not naturally like. Help us to follow the example of Your Son, who loved all people unconditionally. Give us the strength to overcome our selfish desires and choose to love as You have loved us. May our actions and attitudes reflect Your compassion and grace, that we may be a light to the world. Amen.
reflection: Does this mean that if we dislike someone we are not a Christian? These verses are not talking about disliking a disagreeable Christian brother or sister. There will always be people we will not like as well as others. John’s words focus on the attitude that causes us to ignore or despise others, to treat them as irritants, competitors, or enemies. Christian love is not a feeling but a choice. We can choose to be concerned with people’s well-being and treat them with respect, whether or not we feel affection toward them. If we choose to love others, God will help us express our love.
subject: Can You Love Someone but Still Dislike Them?
verse_text: If anyone says, “I am living in the light,” but hates a  Christian brother or sister, that person is still living in  darkness. Anyone who loves other Christians is living  in the light and does not cause anyone to stumble.  Anyone who hates a Christian brother or sister is walk- ing in darkness. Such a person is lost, having been blinded  by the darkness.

original_content:
message_id: 175cdf8fa6015213
subject   : Subject: IT'S TIME TO EXPRESS YOURS (11-16-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 15 Nov 2020 16:14:08 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*The Lord said to Moses—“Give these further instructions to *

*the Israelites when you present a peace offering: to the Lord, bring part
of it as a special gift to the Lord. Present it to him with your own hands
as an offering given to the Lord.”*

(Lev. 7:28-30a)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God told the people of Israel to bring their peace offerings personally,
with their own hands. They were to take time

and effort to express thanks to God. You are the *only* person who can
express your thankfulness to God and to others. Do you leave it to others
to express thanks for what people have done? Do you rely on the one leading
the prayer to thank God for you? *Take time yourself to express thanks* *both
to God and to others who have helped and blessed you.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: God told the people of Israel to bring their peace offerings personally, with their own hands. They were to take time and effort to express thanks to God. You are the only person who can express your thankfulness to God and to others. Do you leave it to others to express thanks for what people have done? Do you rely on the one leading the prayer to thank God for you? Take time yourself to express thanks both to God and to others who have helped and blessed you.
original_verse_text: The Lord said to Moses - "Give these further instructions to  the Israelites when you present a peace offering: to the Lord, bring part of it as a special gift to the Lord. Present it to him with your own hands as an offering given to the Lord."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that every good and perfect gift comes from You (James 1:17). Help us to follow the example of Your people, who were called to bring their offerings to You with their own hands, expressing heartfelt gratitude. May we not rely on others to give thanks on our behalf, but may we take the time to personally offer our praise and thanksgiving to You, the giver of all good things. In all that we do, whether in word or deed, may we do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to You, our God and Father (Colossians 3:17). Amen.
reflection: God told the people of Israel to bring their peace offerings personally, with their own hands. They were to take time and effort to express thanks to God. You are the only person who can express your thankfulness to God and to others. Do you leave it to others to express thanks for what people have done? Do you rely on the one leading the prayer to thank God for you? Take time yourself to express thanks both to God and to others who have helped and blessed you.
subject: It's Time to Express Yours
verse_text: The Lord said to Moses - “Give these further instructions to  the Israelites when you present a peace offering: to the Lord, bring part of it as a special gift to the Lord. Present it to him with your own hands as an offering given to the Lord.”

original_content:
message_id: 175d382ead00d707
subject   : Subject: DAVID'S SONG OF PRAISE (11-17-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 16 Nov 2020 18:02:54 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses: *(Chr. 16:7-12)

*Give thanks to the Lord and proclaim His greatness,8a*

*Sing to Him; yes, sing His praises,9a*

*Exalt Hi holy name; o worshipers of the Lord, rejoice! 10.*

*Search for the Lord and for His strength and keep on *

*searching. 11.*

*Think of the wonderful works He has done, 12a*



*Today’s Reflection:*

Four elements of true thankfulness are found in this song:

(1) Remembering what God has done,

(2) Telling others about it.

(3) Showing God’s glory to others, and

(4) Offering gifts of self, time, and resources.

*If you are truly thankful your life will show it.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Four elements of true thankfulness are found in this song:
(1) Remembering what God has done,
(2) Telling others about it.
(3) Showing God’s glory to others, and
(4) Offering gifts of self, time, and resources.
If you are truly thankful your life will show it.
original_verse_text: 1 Give thanks to the Lord, call on his name; make known among the nations what he has done. 2 Sing to him, sing praise to him; tell of all his wonderful acts. 3 Glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice. 4 Look to the Lord and his strength; seek his face always. 5 Remember the wonders he has done, his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced,
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, remembering the mighty works You have done throughout history. Your faithfulness and love endure forever, and we are in awe of Your power and grace. Help us, Lord, to not only treasure these truths in our own hearts, but to boldly proclaim them to others, that they may see Your glory and be drawn to You. May our lives be a living testament to Your goodness, as we offer ourselves, our time, and our resources in service to You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Four elements of true thankfulness are found in this song: (1) Remembering what God has done, (2) Telling others about it. (3) Showing God's glory to others, and (4) Offering gifts of self, time, and resources. If you are truly thankful, your life will show it.
subject: David's Song of Praise
verse_text: 1 Give thanks to the Lord, call on his name; make known among the nations what he has done. 2 Sing to him, sing praise to him; tell of all his wonderful acts. 3 Glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice. 4 Look to the Lord and his strength; seek his face always. 5 Remember the wonders he has done, his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced,

original_content:
message_id: 175d810cc227ed1e
subject   : Subject: IN ALL AREAS OF LIFE (11-18-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 17 Nov 2020 15:16:21 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*I give you thanks, O Lord, with all my heart; I will sing Your praises
before the gods. I bow before Your holy Temple as I worship. I will give
thanks to Your name for Your unfailing *

*love and faithfulness, because Your promises are backed by *

*all the honor of Your name. *(Ps. 138:1-3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Thanksgiving should be an integral part of our praise to

God. This theme is woven throughout the Psalms. As we

praise and thank God for material and spiritual blessings,

we should also thank Him for answered prayer. Remember

when you asked God for protection, strength, comfort,

patience, love, or other special needs, and He supplied

them. *Beware of taking God’s provision and answered prayer for granted.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Thanksgiving should be an integral part of our praise to God. This theme is woven throughout the Psalms. As we praise and thank God for material and spiritual blessings, we should also thank Him for answered prayer. Remember
when you asked God for protection, strength, comfort, patience, love, or other special needs, and He supplied them. Beware of taking God’s provision and answered prayer for granted.
original_verse_text: I give you thanks, O Lord, with all my heart; I will sing Your praises before the gods. I bow before Your holy Temple as I worship. I will give thanks to Your name for Your unfailing  love and faithfulness, because Your promises are backed by  all the honor of Your name.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, filled with praise and thanksgiving. Your steadfast love endures forever, and Your faithfulness is unfailing. We thank You, Lord, for the many ways You have answered our prayers, providing for our needs and strengthening us in times of weakness. May our prayers be marked by constant thanksgiving, as we remember Your goodness and the blessings You have so graciously bestowed upon us. We lift our voices in joyful adoration, for You are worthy of all our praise. Amen.
reflection: Thanksgiving should be an integral part of our praise to God. This theme is woven throughout the Psalms. As we praise and thank God for material and spiritual blessings, we should also thank Him for answered prayer. Remember when you asked God for protection, strength, comfort, patience, love, or other special needs, and He supplied them. Beware of taking God's provision and answered prayer for granted.
subject: In All Areas of Life
verse_text: I give you thanks, O Lord, with all my heart; I will sing Your praises before the gods. I bow before Your holy Temple as I worship. I will give thanks to Your name for Your unfailing  love and faithfulness, because Your promises are backed by  all the honor of Your name.

original_content:
message_id: 175ddaddaf1e1ee8
subject   : Subject: DEMONSTRATED BY THE LEPER (11-19-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 18 Nov 2020 17:26:00 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Subject: DEMONSTRATED BY THE LEPER (11-19-20)*



*Today’s Verse:*

*Only one leper returned, shouting “Praise God I am healed!”*

* he fell face down on the ground at Jesus feet, thanking Him*

* for what He had done. This man was a Samaritan. *

(Lk. 17:15b-16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus healed all ten lepers, but only one returned to thank

Him. It is possible to receive God’s great gifts with an ungrateful spirit—9
of the 10 men did so. Only the thank-

ful man, however learned that his faith had played a role

in his healing, and only grateful Christians grow in under-

standing God’s grace. *God does not demand that we*

*thank Him, but He** is pleased when we do so. And He*

*uses our responsive**ness to teach us more about Himself.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Jesus healed all ten lepers, but only one returned to thank Him. It is possible to receive God’s great gifts with an ungrateful spirit9 of the 10 men did so. Only the thank ful man, however learned that his faith had played a role in his healing, and only grateful Christians grow in under standing God’s grace. God does not demand that we thank Him, but He is pleased when we do so. And He uses our responsiveness to teach us more about Himself.
original_verse_text: Only one leper returned, shouting “Praise God I am healed!” he fell face down on the ground at Jesus feet, thanking Him for what He had done. This man was a Samaritan.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before you with grateful hearts, for you have showered us with countless blessings. Like the one leper who returned to give thanks, may we never take your grace for granted. Help us to recognize that our faith plays a role in the miracles you perform in our lives. May our responsiveness to your goodness deepen our understanding of your love and mercy. We give you all the glory, for you alone are worthy of our praise. Amen.
reflection: Jesus healed all ten lepers, but only one returned to thank him. It is possible to receive God's great gifts with an ungrateful spirit. 9 of the 10 men did so. Only the thankful man, however, learned that his faith had played a role in his healing, and only grateful Christians grow in understanding God's grace. God does not demand that we thank him, but he is pleased when we do so. And he uses our responsiveness to teach us more about himself.
subject: Demonstrated by the Leper
verse_text: Only one leper returned, shouting “Praise God I am healed!” he fell face down on the ground at Jesus feet, thanking Him for what He had done. This man was a Samaritan.

original_content:
message_id: 175e2d219402c814
subject   : Subject: PROPER RESPONSE TO SALVATION (11-20-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 19 Nov 2020 17:23:41 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*God saved you by His special favor when you believed. *

*And **you can not take credit for this; it is a gift from God. *

*Sal**vation is not a reward for good things we have done, *

*so **none of us can boast about it. *(Eph. 2:8-9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When someone gives you a gift, do you say, “That’s

very nice—now how much do I owe you?” No, the

appropriate response to a gift is, “Thank you!’ Yet

how often Christians, even after they have been given

the gift of salvation, feel obligated to try and work

for their way to God. *Because **our salvation and *

*even our faith are gifts, we should** respond with *

*gratitude, praise, and joy.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: When someone gives you a gift, do you say, “That’s very nice-now how much do I owe you?” No, the appropriate response to a gift is, “Thank you!’ Yet how often Christians, even after they have been given the gift of salvation, feel obligated to try and work for their way to God. Because our salvation and even our faith are gifts, we should respond with gratitude, praise, and joy.
original_verse_text: God saved you by His special favor when you believed.  And you can not take credit for this; it is a gift from God.  Salvation is not a reward for good things we have done,  so none of us can boast about it.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of salvation that You have freely bestowed upon us. We acknowledge that it is not by our own works or merit, but by Your grace that we are saved through faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to receive this gift with grateful hearts, not seeking to earn it, but simply rejoicing in Your unmerited love and mercy. May our lives be a testament to the transformative power of Your grace. Amen.
reflection: When someone gives you a gift, do you say, “That's very nice—now how much do I owe you?” No, the appropriate response to a gift is, “Thank you!” Yet how often Christians, even after they have been given the gift of salvation, feel obligated to try and work their way to God. Because our salvation and even our faith are gifts, we should respond with gratitude, praise, and joy.
subject: Proper Response to Salvation
verse_text: God saved you by His special favor when you believed.  And you can not take credit for this; it is a gift from God.  Salvation is not a reward for good things we have done,  so none of us can boast about it.

original_content:
message_id: 175e80f621b529f5
subject   : Subject: HOW TO LIVE OUR LIFE (11-21-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 20 Nov 2020 17:48:44 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse: *

*Enter His gates with thanksgiving; go into His courts*

*with praise. Give thanks to Him and praise His name. *

(Ps. 100:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God alone is worthy of being worshiped. What is

your attitude toward worship? Do you willingly and

joyfully come into God’s presence, or are you just

going through the motions, reluctantly going to church?

This Psalm tells us to remember God’s goodness and dependability. *AND **then
to worship with thanks-*

*giving and praise.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: God alone is worthy of being worshiped. What is your attitude toward worship? Do you willingly and joyfully come into God’s presence, or are you just going through the motions, reluctantly going to church? This Psalm tells us to remember God’s goodness and dependability. AND then to worship with thanks giving and praise.
original_verse_text: Enter His gates with thanksgiving; go into His courts with praise. Give thanks to Him and praise His name.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, recognizing Your sovereignty and the privilege of entering Your presence. Help us to worship You with sincerity, not merely going through the motions, but offering the sacrifice of praise from our lips, exalting Your name and giving thanks for Your unfailing love and faithfulness. May our worship be a reflection of the joy and reverence we have for You, the one true God. Amen.
reflection: God alone is worthy of being worshipped. What is your attitude toward worship? Do you willingly and joyfully come into God's presence, or are you just going through the motions, reluctantly going to church? This Psalm tells us to remember God's goodness and dependability, and then to worship with thanksgiving and praise.
subject: How to Live Our Life
verse_text: Enter His gates with thanksgiving; go into His courts with praise. Give thanks to Him and praise His name.

original_content:
message_id: 175ecbe9b8a80a91
subject   : Subject: FOR GOD'S AVAILABLE STRENGTH (11-22-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 21 Nov 2020 15:38:36 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Always give thanks for everything to God the Father in the*

*name of your Lord Jesus Christ. **(Eph. 5:20)*



*Today’s Reflection:*

When you feel down, you may find it difficult to give

thanks. Take heart—in all things God works for our

good if we love Him and are called by Him (Ro. 8:28).

Thank God not for your problems but for the strength

He is building in you through the difficult experiences

Of your life. *You can be sure that God’s perfect love *

*will see you through.*

* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text:
When you feel down, you may find it difficult to give
thanks.
Take heart-in all things God works for our
good if we love Him and are called by Him (Romans 8:28).
Thank God not for your problems but for the strength
He is building in you through the difficult experiences
Of your life. You can be sure that God’s perfect love will see you through.
original_verse_text: Always give thanks for everything to God the Father in the name of your Lord Jesus Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, even in the midst of life's challenges. Help us to remember that in all things, You are working for our good, as we love and trust in You. Give us the strength and wisdom to give thanks, not just for our blessings, but for the trials that mold us and draw us closer to You. May Your perfect love and peace surround us, guiding us through every circumstance. Amen.
reflection: When you feel down, you may find it difficult to give thanks. Take heart—in all things, God works for our good if we love Him and are called by Him (Romans 8:28). Thank God not for your problems but for the strength He is building in you through the difficult experiences of your life. You can be sure that God's perfect love will see you through.
subject: For God's Available Strength
verse_text: Always give thanks for everything to God the Father in the name of your Lord Jesus Christ.

original_content:
message_id: 175f2330eac0f2ae
subject   : Subject: TO THOSE WHO BRING YOU JOY (11-23-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 22 Nov 2020 17:03:54 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*We thank God for you! Because of you we have great joy *

*in **the presence of God. Night and day we pray earnestly *

*for **you, asking God to let us see you again to fill up any-*

*thing** that may still be missing in your faith. *

*(I Thess. 3:9-10)*



*Today’s Reflection:*

It should bring great joy to a Christian to see another

person come to faith in Christ and mature in that faith.

Paul experienced this joy many times. He thank God

for those who had come to know Christ and for their

strong faith. He also prayed for their continued growth*. *

*If there are new Christ**ians who have brought you *

*joy, thank God for them and**support them as they *

*continue to grow in the faith. *

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: It should bring great joy to a Christian to see another person come to faith in Christ and mature in that faith. Paul experienced this joy many times. He thank God for those who had come to know Christ and for their strong faith. He also prayed for their continued growth. If there are new Christians who have brought you joy, thank God for them andsupport them as they continue to grow in the faith.
original_subject: TO THOSE WHO BRING YOU JOY
original_verse_text: We thank God for you! Because of you we have great joy  in the presence of God. Night and day we pray earnestly  for you, asking God to let us see you again to fill up any- thing that may still be missing in your faith.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give You thanks for the precious souls who have come to know Your Son, Jesus Christ, as their Lord and Savior. We rejoice in the faith that You have kindled within them and the growth they have experienced. Lord, we pray that You would continue to work in their lives, strengthening their faith and maturing them in Your ways. May their love and devotion to You overflow, bearing much fruit for Your kingdom. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: It should bring great joy to a Christian to see another person come to faith in Christ and mature in that faith. Paul experienced this joy many times. He thanked God for those who had come to know Christ and for their strong faith. He also prayed for their continued growth. If there are new Christians who have brought you joy, thank God for them and support them as they continue to grow in the faith.
subject: To Those Who Bring You Joy
verse_text: We thank God for you! Because of you we have great joy  in the presence of God. Night and day we pray earnestly  for you, asking God to let us see you again to fill up any- thing that may still be missing in your faith.

original_content:
message_id: 175f71a5a6c09a7a
subject   : Subject: WHY BE THANKFUL (11-24-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 23 Nov 2020 15:55:01 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Because of our faith Christ has brought us into this*

*place of highest privilege where we now stand, and*

*we confidently and joyfully look forward to sharing*

*God’s glory. *(Jn. 5:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Paul states that, as believers, we now stand in a

place of highest privilege. Not only has God

declared us as not guilty, He has drawn us close

to Himself*. *Instead of being enemies, we have

become His friends—in-fact, His own children

(Jn. 15:15). *So why shouldn’t **we be thankful?*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: Paul states that, as believers, we now stand in a place of highest privilege. Not only has God declared us as not guilty, He has drawn us close to Himself. Instead of being enemies, we have become His friends-in-fact, His own children (John 15:15). So why should’t we be thankful?
original_verse_text: Because of our faith Christ has brought us into this place of highest privilege where we now stand, and we confidently and joyfully look forward to sharing God’s glory.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the incredible privilege of being called Your children. Through the work of Your Son, Jesus, we have been adopted into Your family, no longer strangers but beloved heirs (Romans 8:16-17). May we live in the joy and confidence of this new identity, walking in the freedom and power of Your Spirit. We praise You, our gracious and merciful God. Amen.
reflection: Paul states that, as believers, we now stand in a place of highest privilege. Not only has God declared us as not guilty, He has drawn us close to Himself. Instead of being enemies, we have become His friends-in-fact, His own children (John 15:15). So why shouldn't we be thankful?
subject: Why be Thankful
verse_text: Because of our faith Christ has brought us into this place of highest privilege where we now stand, and we confidently and joyfully look forward to sharing God’s glory.

original_content:
message_id: 175fc66b54309954
subject   : 
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 24 Nov 2020 16:36:31 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Subject: SHOULD BE A CONTINIOUS PART OF LIFE *

(11-25-26)



*Today’s Verse: *

*David appointed a group of Levites to lead the people *

*in worship before the Ark of the Lord by asking for His*

*blessings and giving thanks and praise to the Lord, the*

*God of Israel. *(I Chron. 16:4)



*Today’s Revelation:*

Certain Levities were appointed to give continual praise

and thanks to God. Praise and thanksgiving should be

a regular part of *our* routine, not reserved only for cel-

ebrations. *If we praise God continually, we will find *

*that we will not take God’s blessing for granted.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Certain Levities were appointed to give continual praise and
thanks to God. Praise and thanksgiving should be a
regular part of our routine, not reserved only for 
celebrations. If we praise God continually, we will find that 
we will not take God’s blessing for granted.
original_subject: SHOULD BE A CONTINIOUS PART OF LIFE
original_verse_text:
David appointed a group of Levites to lead the people in
worship before the Ark of the Lord by asking for His blessings
and giving thanks and praise to the Lord, the God of Israel.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking to follow the example of the Levites who gave continual praise and thanks to You. As the psalmist declares, we desire to bless Your name at all times, with Your praise continually on our lips. Help us to cultivate a spirit of thankfulness, that we may never take for granted the abundant blessings You have bestowed upon us. May our lives be a constant offering of worship and adoration to You, our Almighty God. Amen.
reflection: Certain Levites were appointed to give continual praise and thanks to God. Praise and thanksgiving should be a regular part of our routine, not reserved only for celebrations. If we praise God continually, we will find that we will not take God's blessings for granted.
subject: Should be a Continuous Part of Life
verse_text:
David appointed a group of Levites to lead the people in
worship before the Ark of the Lord by asking for His blessings
and giving thanks and praise to the Lord, the God of Israel.

original_content:
message_id: 176019979b2fa626
subject   : Subject: OBSERVING THANKSGIVING (11-26-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 25 Nov 2020 16:50:04 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“Count it all joy” *(Jm. 1:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Count your blessings instead of you crosses:

Count your gains instead of your losses:

Count your joys instead of your woes:

Count your friends instead of your foes:

Count your smiles instead of your tears:

Count your courage instead of your fears:

Count your full years instead of your lean:

Count your kind deeds instead of your mean:

Count your health instead of your wealth:

*Count on God instead of yourself.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Count your blessings instead of you crosses:
Count your gains instead of your losses:
Count your joys instead of your woes:
Count your friends instead of your foes:
Count your smiles instead of your tears:
Count your courage instead of your fears:
Count your full years instead of your lean:
Count your kind deeds instead of your mean:
Count your health instead of your wealth:
Count on God instead of yourself.
original_verse_text: "Count it all joy."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the many blessings You have bestowed upon us. Help us to shift our focus from our troubles and trials, and instead count the joys, the gains, and the kind deeds that fill our lives. Remind us to find our strength and hope in You, rather than in ourselves. May we rejoice in Your presence and cast our anxieties upon You, knowing that Your peace surpasses all understanding. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Count your blessings instead of your crosses. Count your gains instead of your losses. Count your joys instead of your woes. Count your friends instead of your foes. Count your smiles instead of your tears. Count your courage instead of your fears. Count your full years instead of your lean. Count your kind deeds instead of your mean. Count your health instead of your wealth. Count on God instead of yourself.
subject: Observing Thanksgiving
verse_text: “Count it all joy.”

original_content:
message_id: 17606990afb54c57
subject   : Subject: OFFERED AS OUR SUBSTITUTE (11-27-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 26 Nov 2020 16:07:42 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

(God provided a ram, in place of Abraham’s)—*Then *

*Abraham looked up and saw a ram caught by his horns*

* in a bush. So he took the ram and sacrificed it as a burn*

* offering on the altar in place of his son. *(Gen. 22:13)




*Today’s Reflection: *Notice the parallel between the ram offered on the
altar as

a substitute for Isaac and Christ offered on the cross as a

substitute for us. Whereas God stopped Abraham from

sacrificing his son, God did not spare His own Son, Jesus,

from dying, on the cross. If Jesus had lived, the rest of

humankind would have died. God sent His only Son to die

for us so that we can be spared from the eternal death we

deserve and instead receive eternal life (Jn. 3:16)

*Did you remember to give thanks, thanks-giving day for*

* this undeserved gift of eternal life?*

* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text:
Notice the parallel between the ram offered on the altar as
a substitute for Isaac and Christ offered on the cross as a
substitute for us. Whereas God stopped Abraham from
sacrificing his son, God did not spare His own Son, Jesus,
from dying, on the cross. If Jesus had lived, the rest of
humankind would have died. God sent His only Son to die
for us so that we can be spared from the eternal death we
deserve and instead receive eternal life (John 3:16)
Did you remember to give thanks, thanksgiving day for this undeserved gift of eternal life?
original_verse_text: Abraham looked up and there in a thicket he saw a ram caught by its horns. He went over and took the ram and sacrificed it as a burnt offering instead of his son.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your great love, that You did not spare Your own Son, but gave Him up for us all (John 3:16). Just as You provided a ram as a substitute for Isaac, You have provided Your Son, Jesus, as the ultimate sacrifice to redeem us from the death we deserve. We are humbled by this undeserved gift of eternal life, and we praise You for Your mercy and grace. Amen.
reflection: Notice the parallel between the ram offered on the altar as a substitute for Isaac and Christ offered on the cross as a substitute for us. Whereas God stopped Abraham from sacrificing his son, God did not spare His own Son, Jesus, from dying on the cross. If Jesus had lived, the rest of humankind would have died. God sent His only Son to die for us so that we can be spared from the eternal death we deserve and instead receive eternal life (John 3:16). Did you remember to give thanks, Thanksgiving Day, for this undeserved gift of eternal life?
subject: Offered as Our Substitute
verse_text: Abraham looked up and there in a thicket he saw a ram caught by its horns. He went over and took the ram and sacrificed it as a burnt offering instead of his son.

original_content:
message_id: 1760c020761942bd
subject   : Subject: MADE IN GOD'S FAVOR (11-28-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 27 Nov 2020 17:20:28 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*You made all the delicate, inner parts of **my **body*

*and knit me together in my mother’s **womb. Thank *

*You for making me wonder**fully complex! Your *

*workmanship is mar**velous—and how well *

*I know **it. You wat**ched me as I was being *

*formed in utter **seclusion, as I was woven *

*together in the **dark of **the womb.*



*Today’s Reflection:*

God’s character goes into the creation of

every person. When you feel worthless or

even begin to hate yourself, *remember* that

God’s Spirit is ready and willing to work

within you. *We should** have as much *

*respect for ourselves as our **Maker has *

*for us.*

* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text: God’s character goes into the creation of every person. When you feel worthless or even begin to hate yourself, remember that God’s Spirit is ready and willing to work within you. We should have as much respect for ourselves as our Maker has for us.
original_verse_text: You made all the delicate, inner parts of my body  and knit me together in my mother’s womb. Thank  You for making me wonderfully complex! Your  workmanship is marvelous-and how well  I know it. You watched me as I was being  formed in utter seclusion, as I was woven  together in the dark of the womb.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for knitting us together in our mother's womb, for fearfully and wonderfully making each of us (Psalm 139:13-15). Help us to see ourselves as Your workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works (Ephesians 2:10). When we struggle with feelings of worthlessness, remind us of the great value You place on us as Your beloved children. May we have the same respect for ourselves that You have for us. Amen.
reflection: God's character goes into the creation of every person. When you feel worthless or even begin to hate yourself, remember that God's Spirit is ready and willing to work within you. We should have as much respect for ourselves as our Maker has for us.
subject: Made in God's Favor
verse_text: You made all the delicate, inner parts of my body  and knit me together in my mother’s womb. Thank  You for making me wonderfully complex! Your  workmanship is marvelous-and how well  I know it. You watched me as I was being  formed in utter seclusion, as I was woven  together in the dark of the womb.

original_content:
message_id: 1761ab09c6a31fca
subject   : Subject: THE ISSUE IS OBEDIENCE (12-1-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 30 Nov 2020 13:45:51 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Not all people who sound religious are really godly, they may*

*refer to me as ‘Lord’, but they still won’t enter the Kingdom*

*of Heaven. The decisive issue is whether they obey my Father*

*in heaven. *(Mt. 7:21)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Some self-professed athletes can “talk” a great game, but that

tells you noting about their athletic skills. And not everyone

who talks about heaven belongs to God’s Kingdom Jesus is

more concerned about our walk than our talk. He want us to

do right, not just say the right words. *What you do cannot *

*be separated from what you believe.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Some self-professed athletes can “talk” a great game, but that
tells you noting about their athletic skills. And not everyone
who talks about heaven belongs to God’s Kingdom Jesus is
more concerned about our walk than our talk. He want us to
do right, not just say the right words. What you do cannot be separated from what you believe.
original_verse_text: Not all people who sound religious are really godly, they may refer to me as ‘Lord’, but they still won’t enter the Kingdom of Heaven. The decisive issue is whether they obey my Father in heaven.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that our actions must align with our professions of faith. Help us to be doers of Your Word, not merely hearers. May our lives reflect the love, compassion, and service that You have called us to, so that our faith may be made complete through our works. Guide us to live out the truth of Your Kingdom, not just speak of it. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: Some self-professed athletes can “talk” a great game, but that tells you nothing about their athletic skills. And not everyone who talks about heaven belongs to God's Kingdom. Jesus is more concerned about our walk than our talk. He wants us to do right, not just say the right words. What you do cannot be separated from what you believe.
subject: The Issue is Obedience
verse_text: Not all people who sound religious are really godly, they may refer to me as ‘Lord’, but they still won’t enter the Kingdom of Heaven. The decisive issue is whether they obey my Father in heaven.
